alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 29 at 7:32PM MDT until April 30 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MDT /1 AM CDT/ TONIGHT TO 3 PM MDT /4 PM CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Red Willow, Hitchcock and Dundy Counties. In Colorado, Kit Carson and Yuma Counties. * WHEN...From midnight MDT /1 AM CDT/ tonight to 3 PM MDT /4 PM CDT/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Reductions in visibility associated with blowing dust possible.
info.instruction: Difficult travel conditions are expected tonight and Saturday. Watch for objects blowing across the roadway and into your path. Keep a safe distance from cars in adjacent lanes as strong gusts could suddenly push a vehicle outside its lane of travel. Take extra care in high-profile vehicles such as a truck, van, or SUV, or when towing a trailer, as these are more prone to be pushed or even flipped by high winds.
